meanings.definition: A person or thing that repels.
meanings.sent1: The strong smell acted as a repeller to keep the bees away.
meanings.sent2: The scarecrow was an effective repeller of birds in the cornfield.
meanings.sent3: The noisy toy car became a repeller for the quiet library.
meanings.sent4: Her stern expression was a repeller to anyone trying to approach her.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors of the sign served as a repeller for the moths at night.

meanings.definition: A substance used to repel insects.
meanings.sent1: The citronella oil was a natural repeller for mosquitoes.
meanings.sent2: She sprayed the insect repeller around the picnic area to keep bugs away.
meanings.sent3: The lemon-scented repeller made the room smell fresh while keeping flies out.
meanings.sent4: The insect repeller created a protective barrier against unwanted pests.
meanings.sent5: The herbal repeller effectively deterred ants from entering the kitchen.

meanings.sent1: The ultrasonic repeller emitted sounds that kept rodents away from the house.
meanings.sent2: The motion-activated repeller startled deer and prevented them from entering the garden.
meanings.sent3: The robotic repeller moved around the yard, scaring off unwanted critters.
meanings.sent4: The solar-powered repeller used flashing lights to deter animals from approaching.
meanings.sent5: The electronic repeller used vibrations to create a barrier that animals avoided.
